Ralph Loomis Papers, 1963-1989

did.physloc: Collection stored offsite; two days notice required for retrieval.
did.abstract: Ralph A. Loomis was a professor of English in the English and Humanities department of the College of Engineering at the University of Michigan. He made significant contributions to faculty governance while teaching at the University of Michigan, 1953-1993. The collection ranges from 1963 to 1989 (bulk 1968-1975, 1983). The records contain information on the College of Engineering and the Department of English, including the dissolution of the Department and Loomis' involvement in many committees on campus, and documentation of the Johnathan Marwil court case.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Ralph A. Loomis in April 1997. Donor no. 8581

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research except for scattered files as noted.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Ralph Loomis Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Ralph A. Loomis was a professor of English in the English and Humanities department of the College of Engineering at the University of Michigan. He taught at the university from 1953 until 1992.

Ralph A. Loomis was born August 22, 1923. He received degrees from the University of Missouri, Oberlin College and Northwestern University, receiving his doctorate from Northwestern in 1956. His career at Michigan was spent teaching English in the College of Engineering. In 1993, he became a Professor Emeritus of English with the College of Engineering. During his almost forty years at the university he was very active in departmental, college, and university committees. He was also involved in the American Association of University Professors (AAUP) during the same period of time. As a member of the AAUP he served on committees at the university, state, and national level, including six years as president of the Michigan Conference (state organization) of the AAUP.

scopecontent.p: As an active member of committees at both the University of Michigan and as a member of the AAUP, Ralph Loomis comprehensively collected correspondence and memoranda from the work of Department of English and Humanities committees, College of Engineering committees, and University committees established by the Senate Assembly and SACUA, as well as various ad hoc committees established by the university.

As a member of the AAUP, Ralph Loomis collected a wide array of correspondence, memoranda, and minutes of the university, state, and national chapters, as well as working committees of those chapters. Especially interesting is the collection of papers relating to collective bargaining. These papers include speeches that Ralph Loomis gave on collective bargaining, as well as papers relating to the collective bargaining elections at Eastern Michigan, Northern Michigan, and Wayne State, which occurred during 1971 to 1972.

The collection is divided into four major series: Department of Humanities/English, College of Engineering, University of Michigan, American Association of University Professors, Dissolving of the Department, General Files, and Johnathan Marwil Case.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: American Association of University Professors. University of Michigan Chapter.
University of Michigan. College of Engineering.
University of Michigan. College of Engineering. Dept. of English.

scopecontent.p: The Department of Humanities/English of the College of Engineering series (Box 1) is arranged by the committees on which he served: the Ad Hoc Review Committee, the Administrative Committee, the Curriculum Committee. The committee folders cover primarily the period between 1965 to 1975.

The College of Engineering of the University of Michigan series contains correspondence, memoranda, and minutes from primarily the Scholastic Standing Committee and the Library Council. The committee folders cover primarily 1971-1985.
The University of Michigan general series contains correspondence and memoranda from Senate and SACUA committees, such as the Early Retirement Committee. The series covers primarily 1971 to 1978.

did.unittitle: Ad Hoc Committee on Annuitants Benefits 1978-1980
Ad Hoc Committee to Advise President Hatcher on the Relation of the University to the State Board of Education. 1964
Ad Hoc Committee to Advise the Vice President on Allocation of Salary Adjustments 1973
Ad Hoc Committee of University of Michigan Health Maintenance Organization 1975-1978
Committee on the Economic Status of the Faculty
Phi Beta Kappa, University of Michigan Chapter Board
Senate Advisory Committee on University Affairs
Committee on Faculty Participation in Governance, University of Michigan-Flint 1972-1973
University Library Council, Memoranda and Minutes
Vice-president Brinkerhoff's HMO Advisory Committee circa 1980

scopecontent.p: The Association of University Professors series contains correspondence, memoranda and minutes from the university chapter, the state chapter, and the national chapter. The series also contains a large amount of speeches, correspondence, and memoranda relating to collective bargaining campaigns at Michigan universities. The series covers primarily 1970 to 1979.

The Dissolving of Department series includes committee reports, correspondence, and faculty responses to the dissolving of the Department of Humanities from the College of Engineering and its movement into the College of LSA. The bulk of the material is from 1983.

did.unittitle: American Association of University Professors undated

scopecontent.p: The General Files series is organized alphabetically by topical file. Of particular interest are: the file on the committees Loomis participated in, the promotions and awards he received, the water polo Flounders Group which he was a member of, fliers for radical movements that were occurring on campus, and notes on the speeches he presented. The series covers a broad range of material from 1962-1989.

did.unittitle: Senate Advisory Committee on University Affairs 1964-1987

scopecontent.p: The Johnathan Marwil Case series contains information regarding the case and trial of faculty member Johnathan Marwil. Marwil was denied tenure and brought the issue to federal court. Loomis kept correspondence regarding the case, the opinions of the faculty on the issue, and copies of the information presented at the trial as well as a transcript of the trial. The material ranges from 1979-1980.
